intro: Eriogonum obtusum, commonly known as the bluntleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its simple, broad leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriogonum obtusum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in sagebrush steppe and chaparral ecosystems.
